task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 258°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full building extent, so I'll tilt up to capture roofline and estimate floors.
The prompt specifies the target building is to the West (~258°), so I should rotate left toward West while keeping the upward pitch to see the top.
I need to see the building’s roofline and overall vertical extent in this westward view, so I’ll tilt up.
The view has snapped back to north; I must rotate to west (270°) to face the target building and keep the upward pitch for height estimation.
To estimate height I need the top of the façade/roof in view, so I will pitch upward while staying aimed west.
The heading has reset north again; rotate back to west to keep the target building centered for measurement.
I now need to stop rotating and give the height estimate based on the west-facing building view using typical floor-to-floor scale.
